comment: For two positive integers less than a given prime number there is always a nonnegative integer (less than the given prime number) so that the sum of one of the two positive integers and the other of the positive integers multiplied by the nonnegative integer is 0 ( modulo the given prime number). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 17-May-2018.)
